articles.content: MOGADISHU, SomaliaThe young victims of an intensifying global food crisis are being buried in unmarked graves. In crowded malnutrition wards, families are waiting for one ailing child to be discharge… [+455 chars]

articles.title: The Tricks to Using Your Phone When Traveling Internationally
articles.description: Set up an app to call home for free and buy local data cheaply to get ahead of fees.
articles.content: Some vacations are intended to be unplugged bliss. This column is for the other kind, where you want to use your phone like you do at hometo rent bikes, book tickets, make reservations and, lets be h… [+270 chars]

articles.author: Matt Wirz
articles.title: High-Tech Weathermen Forecast Climate Risks for Bond Markets - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Startups use satellite imaging, public databases and algorithms to map out threats of natural disasters for specific towns—and even buildings—that back bonds
articles.content: For centuries, bond investing has boiled down to forecasting two things: which way interest rates are going to move and how likely a borrower is to repay its debts. A handful of startups are betting … [+516 chars]

articles.author: Nick Timiraos
articles.title: For the Fed, Easing Too Soon Risks Repeat of Stop-and-Go 1970s
articles.description: Just as it proved difficult for the Fed last year to tell when to start raising rates, it is tough to know when to stop. What happens if the economy begins slowing sharply but inflation stays high?
articles.content:
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell is raising interest rates at the fastest pace since the 1980s. That has been easy so far because rates are low and the economy has been strong.
The hardest par… [+228 chars]
